characters: EXT. STREET/INT. REAR OF MOVING TRUCK

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: INT. ANDY’S BEDROOM A row of moving boxes lie on the floor of the room. They are drawn up in crayon to look like a miniature Western town. The bedroom is lined with cloud wallpaper giving the impression of sky. One of the boxes has a children’s illustrated “WANTED” poster of a Mr. Potato Head taped to it. A MR. POTATO HEAD DOLL is set in front of the poster. The VOICE OVER of ANDY, a 6-year-old boy, can be heard acting out all the voices of the scene. ANDY (as POTATO HEAD) Alright everyone, this is a stick- up! Don't anybody move! Now empty that safe! A GROUP OF TOYS have been crowded together in front of the “BANK” box. Andy’s hand lowers A CERAMIC PIGGY BANK in front of Mr. Potato Head and shakes out a pile of coins to the floor. Mr. Potato Head kisses the coins. ANDY (as POTATO HEAD) Ooh! Money. Money. Money. (kissing noises) A porcelain figurine of the shepherdess, BO PEEP, is brought into the scene. ANDY (as BO PEEP) Step it! Stop it, you mean old potato! ANDY (as POTATO HEAD) Quiet Bo Peep, or your sheep get run over! The companion porcelain sheep are placed in the center of a Hot Wheels track loop. ANDY (as SHEEP) Heeeeelp! BAAAAA! Heeeelp us!  ANDY (as BO PEEP) Oh, no! Not my sheep! Somebody do something! WOODY, a pull-string rag doll cowboy, enters into the scene opposite the inanimate spud. Andy's hand pulls on the ring in the center of Woody’s back.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (VOICE BOX)
dialogues.text: Reach for the sky. ANDY (as POTATO HEAD) Oh, no! Sheriff Woody!! ANDY (as WOODY) I’m here to stop you, One-Eyed Bart. Andy’s hand pulls out one of Mr. Potato Head’s eyes. ANDY (as POTATO HEAD) Dooooch! How'd you know it was me! ANDY (as WOODY) Are you gonna come quietly?’ ANDY (as POTATO HEAD) You can’t touch me Sheriff! I brought my attack dog with a built- in force field! Andy places a TOY DOG, with a SLINKY for a mid-section, in front of Mr. Potato Head and stretches him out. ANDY (as WOODY) Well I brought my DINOSAUR, who eats force field dogs!! Andy reveals a PLASTIC TYRANNOSAURUS REX, who stomps on the Slinky Dog. ANDY (as DINOSAUR)

dialogues.speaker: AAAAR
dialogues.text: ANDY (as SLINKY DOG)

dialogues.speaker: YIPE
dialogues.text: ANDY (as WOODY) You're goin’ to jail, Bart. Andy picks up Mr. Potato Head and places him in a baby erib in the room.  A cardboard sign is taped to the bars with the word “JAIL” written in crayon. ANDY (as WOODY) Say good-bye to the wife and tatertots. Andy’s l-year~old sister, MOLLY, crawls over and picks up Mr. Potato Head. She sucks on him for a beat then proceeds to pound the toy repeatedly against the rail of her crib, forcing some of his parts loose. Andy, wearing a cowboy hat himself, picks up Woody off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (pulling Woody's string) You saved the day again, Woody.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (VOICE BOX)
dialogues.text: You're my favorite deputy.

dialogues.speaker: BEGIN TITLES
dialogues.text: SONG “YOU'VE GOT A FRIEND IN ME” plays while Andy does various activities with Woody: -- Andy turns the western town boxes around to reveal cows drawn on the other side. He grabs a jump rope and pretends Woody is lassoing the cattle.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: C'mon, let’s wrangle up the cattle. ~- Andy then rides Woody around on an RC (remote control) car, and herds the remaining “cow” boxes under Molly’s crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Andy places Woody on the top of the stairwell banister allowing the doll to slide downstairs. Andy races ahead and catches him at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Andy & Woody fall into the La-Z-Boy chair and spin around and around. Next, Andy uses the La-Z-boy foot rest as a catapult.  Andy flings Woody across the room to the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (raising his arms) Score!

dialogues.speaker: SONG ENDS
dialogues.text: Woody lies limp on the sofa while Andy is heard talking to his mother.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wow! Cool!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Whadda ya think?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, this looks GREAT, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. DAVIS, Andy’s thirty eight-year-old mom, has just finished decorating the area with streamers and balloons. A banner is draped across the archway. It reads: “Happy Birthday Andy”. Woody's frozen face stares in the direction of the birthday decorations.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Can we leave this up ‘til we move?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Well, sure, we can leave it up.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Now go get Molly. Your friends are going to be here any minute.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Okay. Andy picks up Woody from the couch and runs upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It’s partytime, Woody!  INT. ANDY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Andy and Woody enter the room. Molly is still banging Potato Head against her crib railing. Andy tips Woody's hat at her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Howdy, Little Lady! He deposits Woody on the bed and pulls his string one last time.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (VOICE BOX)
dialogues.text: Somebody's poisoned the waterhole.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (picking up Molly) C'mon, Molly. Oh, you're getting heavy! (to Woody) See ya later, Woody. Andy exits.

dialogues.speaker: END TITLES
dialogues.text: Woody's eyes come to life. The cowboy doll sits up, his expression changing from a smile to worry.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to himself) Pull my string! The birthday party’s today?! Woody thinks.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to the room) Okay, everybody. Coast is clear. The bedroom comes alive. TOYS emerge from the toy box, the closet, the shelves, etc... in a flurry of activity. POTATO HEAD, his body parts strewn across the floor, sits himself upright and begins to re-assemble himself.

dialogues.speaker: POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Ages three and up. It’s on my box. Ages three and up! I'm not supposed to be babysitting Princess Drool.  HAMM, the piggy bank, flips one last penny into his coin slot. Potato Head walks up to him. All his facial pieces are in the wrong slots.

dialogues.speaker: POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Hey, Hamm! Look! I'm Picasso!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: I don’t get it. Hamm walks away.

dialogues.speaker: POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: You uncultured swine! (to someone

dialogues.speaker: Q.S.
dialogues.text: What are you looking at, ya hockey puck?! Potato Head walks past, revealing a hockey puck figurine. Woody sits on the edge of the bed observing all the activity. He turns to a plastic green army man, SARGENT, standing on the night stand. woOoDY Uh, hey Sarge, have you seen Slinky?

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: (saluting) Six! No Sir!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you. At ease. Woody hops off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hey, Slinky?

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Right here, Woody! A toy Slinky dog, SLINKY, appears from under the bed pushing out a checker board set. He begins to place the checkers on the board.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: I’m red this time.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, Slink --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... well alright, you can be red if you want.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Not now, Slink. I’ve got some bad news.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Bad news?!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Sh-h-h-h-h!! Woody covers up Slinky’s mouth, aware that the other toys in the room are watching. He leans in close to Slinky.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Just gather everyone up for a staff meeting and be happy!!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Got it. Slinky shuffles off.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Be HAPPY! Slinky perks up his gait and LAUGHS HARD. Woody proceeds in the other direction. He passes a toy ROBOT and SNAKE partially hidden under the bedspread.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to the room) Staff meeting, everybody. (aside) Snake, Robot --~ podium duty. Robot and Snake come out from under the bed and reluctantly follow Woody. Woody walks past an Etch-A-Sketch, ETCH, going the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hey Etch’! Draw! Both Etch and Woody whip around like gunfighters. -7-  Before Woody can fully extend his arm out, the Etch-A- Sketch etches a gun on its screen.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (pretending to be shot) Oh!! You got me again, Etch’! You‘ve been working on that draw. Fastest knobs in the west. Slinky passes a group of toys on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Got a staff meeting, you guys, come on, let’s go! Robot and Snake begin constructing a podium made out of Legos and a Tinker Toy tub while Woody searches the floor.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Now where is that -- ? Aw, hey, who moved my doodle pad way over here? Woody spots the doodle pad on the floor by the desk and walks over to it. As he reaches down to pick it up... REX, the plastic dinosaur, jumps out to scare Woody.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (unaffected) Oh, how ya doin’, Rex? Rex suddenly turns timid.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Were you scared? Tell me honestly.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: I was close to being scared that time. Woody heads back to the podium. Rex follows.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I'm going for fearsome here, but I just don't feel it. JI think I'm just coming off as annoying.  A crook suddenly grabs Woody's neck and jerks him towards BO PEEP, the porcelain figurine.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (choking) Aach! -- Oh, hi, Bo.

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: I wanted to thank you, Woody, for saving my flock.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (blushing) Oh, hey - it was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: Whadda ya say I get someone else to watch the sheep tonight?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (very flustered) Heh, heh... oh yeah, uh, I... Bo saunters back towards her lamp stand, passing a stack of ABC. blocks.

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: Remember, I'm just a couple of blocks away. Woody is left lovestruck. All the rest of the toys in the room are filing past Slinky.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Come on, come on! Smaller toys up front. Woody remains lovestruck in the middle of the room.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Hey, Woody! C’mon! Woody snaps out of his trance and rushes over to the podium. The toys crowd together as Woody steps up to the podium. MIKE, a toy tape recorder, waddles up next to Woody and indicates his microphone.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Ahem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing microphone) Oh, thanks, Mike. {to the crowd) Okay --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: {to Mike) Oh, whoa, step back -- Mike waddles back a step to stop the feedback.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hello? Check? Better? Great. Everybody hear me? Up on the shelf can you hear me? Great! Okay, first item today...oh, yeah. Has everyone picked a moving buddy? The toys all MOAN.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Moving buddy?! You can’t be serious!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Well I didn’t know we were supposed to have one already.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: (waving his arm out its socket) Do we have to hold hands? The toys LAUGH and SNICKER.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, you guys think this is a big joke. We've only got one week left before the move. I don’t want any toys left behind. A moving buddy -- if you don’t have one, get one! (checking the pad) Alright, next...uh...oh, yes. Tuesday night's “Plastic Corrosion Awareness" meeting was, I think, a big success and we want to thank Mr. Spell for putting that on for us. Thank you, Mr. Spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words “You're welcome” scroll across Mr. Spells display screen as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SPELL
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Ok, uh...oh yes. One minor note here... (under his breath) Andy’s birthday party’s been moved to today. (full voice) Next we have -- The toys all PANIC.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: What?! Whadda ya mean, the party’s today?! His birthday’s not ‘til next week! !

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: What's going on down there?’ Is Mom losing her marbles?!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Well, obviously she wanted to have the party before the move. I‘m not worried. You shouldn't be worried.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Of course Woody ain't worried! He’s been Andy’s favorite since Kindergarten!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Hey, hey! Come on, Potato Head! If Woody says it’s all right, then, well, darnit, it's good enough for me. Woody has never steered us wrong before. While Slinky speaks, Potato Head takes off his mouth and Mimes kissing his own butt.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: c’mon, guys! Every Christmas and birthday we go through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if Andy gets another dinosaur? A mean one? I just don’t think I can take that kind of rejection.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, no one’s getting replaced. This is Andy we're talking about. Woody steps down from the podium and walks towards the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (continued) It doesn’t matter how much we‘re played with. What matters is that we're here for Andy when he needs us. That's what we’re made for. Right? Everyone is now looking down, sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Pardon me. I hate to breakup the staff meeting, but, THEY'RE HERE! Birthday guests at three o'clock!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Stay calm, everyone!! foo late. The toys PANIC and stampede over Woody towards the bedroom window, leaving him alone on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Uh, meeting adjourned. The toys all crowd around the bedroom window, trying to get a peek outside.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Oh, boy. Will ya take a look at all those presents?!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: I can’t see a thing! Unable to see over the crowd, Potato Head pulls his eyes out of his head and holds them up over the other toys. ANGLE: TOY’S POV OF ANDY’S FRONT YARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHILDREN file towards the front door carrying presents.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Yessir, we're next month's garage sale fodder for sure.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: (panicked) Any dinosaur-shaped ones?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Ah, for crying out loud, they’re all in boxes, you idiot! The presents keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: They're getting bigger.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Wait! There's a nice little one over there! At first,.the kid’s present appears to, be a little box, but then the kid turns -- the present is four feet long. The toys SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SPELL
dialogues.text: Spell the word “trashcan.”

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: We're doomed! Down on the floor, Woody smacks his hand to his forehead in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Alright! Alright! The toys turn inside and look down at Woody.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (continued) If I send out the troops, will you all calm down?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! We promise!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, save your batteries!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, very good, Woody. That’s using the old noodle. Woody jumps up onto Andy‘s bed and turns to the Sargent on the nightstand.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Sargent. Establish a recon post downstairs. Code red. You know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: Yes SIR! The green army man hops down to the floor where a “BUCKET 0' SOLDIERS” s its.

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: Alright men, you heard him. Code Red! Repeat: We are at Code Red! Recon plan Charlie. Execute! Let’s move move move! ! THE GREEN ARMY MEN file out of the bucket and march in formation across the bedroom floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's door creaks open and a lone army man ventures forth to make sure the coast is clear. Satisfied, he motions for the others to proceed. Squads of soldiers march into the hall carrying a baby monitor and a jump rope. The army men each leapfrog behind the stairway banisters and hold their positions while the Sargent surveys the scene below through his binoculars. ANGLE: SARGENT’S BINOCULAR VIEW OF DOWNSTAIRS Directly below, Mrs. Davis passes through the hallway rounding up Andy and all his birthday guests.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Okay, c’mon kids! Everyone in the living room. It’s almost time for the presents. Once Mrs. Davis and the children are out of sight, the Sargent motions to his men with a silent hand signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PARATROOPERS jump out through the railing, parachuting down to the floor below.

dialogues.speaker: INT, DOWNSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The paratroopers sweep the area with their plastic rifles, then give the “all clear” sign. The jump rope is lowered, and more soldiers rappel down. INT. ANDY’S BEDROOM The toys race towards the nightstand where Woody has placed the receiving half of the baby monitor.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: And this -- (turning on the baby monitor) -- is how we find out what is in those presents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The green army men march in formation across the floor when suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Can be heard approaching from behind the connecting kitchen door. Immediately the Sargent signals for his men to freeze in their various classic action poses.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, who’s hungry? Here come the chips. I’ve got Cool Ranch and Barbeque -- The door opens and Mrs. Davis’ foot comes down hard on top of a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Owww! What in the world -- ? Oh, I thought I told him to pick these up. With a sweep of her foot, she brushes the army men out of her path and continues on to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't they be there by now? What‘s taking them so long?!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hey, these guys are professionals. They’re they best. C'mon, they’re not lying down on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as Mom is gone, the Sargent motions for his men to proceed toward a nearby houseplant that looks into the living room. - The Sargent then notices an injured soldier struggling to drag himself forward -- a casualty of Mrs. Davis’ foot. The Sargent helps the injured soldier to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: WOUNDED SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (moans ) Go on without me. Just go!

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: A good soldier never leaves ‘a man behind. The Sargent motions to the remaining men above. They lower themselves via jump rope, riding the baby monitor. Once downstairs, they hustle the baby monitor towards the houseplant. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: A BALL
dialogues.text: bounces into the hallway, followed by the sound of footsteps and kid clamor. The Sargent, supporting his wounded man, reaches the plant, right on the heels of the squad with the baby monitor. They conceal themselves in the house plant just before the children run by. INT. DOWNSTAIRS - HOUSE PLANT — CONTINUOUS While the baby monitor is set in place, A MEDIC evaluates the wounded soldier and gives the “thumb’s up” signal. The Sargent scans the party with his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pile of brightly wrapped gifts sits atop the living room coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There they are.

dialogues.speaker: INT, ANDY'S ROOM
dialogues.text: The toys perk up as STATIC suddenly emits from the baby monitor. SARGENT (0.S.; over monitor) Come in, Mother Bird, this is Alpha Bravo.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: This is it! This is it! Quiet, quiet, quiet! SARGENT (0.S.; over monitor) Come in, Mother Bird. Alright. ..Andy’s opening the first present now.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: (chanting) Mrs. Potato Head...Mrs. Potato Head...Mrs. Potato Head... (off Rex's look) Hey, I can dream, can’t I? SARGENT (0.S.; over monitor) The bow’s coming off... he’s ripping the wrapping paper... it’s a... it's... it's a lunchbox! We've got a lunchbox, here!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: A lunchbox?!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: A lunchbox...?!

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: For lunch. Heh heh heh... S SARGENT (0.S.; over monitor) Ok, second present... it appears to be... okay, it’s bed sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who invited THAT kid?!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh, only one left. INT. ANDY’S BEDROOM SARGENT (O.S.; over monitor) Okay, we're on the last present now...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Last present! SARGENT (0.S.; over monitor) It's a big one... It’s a... it’s a boardgame! Repeat! Battleship -- Battleship, the boardgame! The toys CHEER WITH RELIEF.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright!! Hamm gives Potato Head a congratulatory pat on the back, sending his facial features flying.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Hey, watch it!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Sorry there, old Spudhead.

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: (to army men) Mission accomplished. Well done, men. Pack it up, we're going home. INT. ANDY’S BEDROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did I tell ya? Huh? Nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: I knew you were right all along, Woody. Never doubted you for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The platoon is preparing to exit the plant when...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Oooh, what do we have here?! The Sargent lifts his binoculars back to his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Davis can be seen opening the closet and pulling out another large present.

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: (indicating the baby monitor) Wait -- turn that thing back on! INT. ANDY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS SARGENT (0.S.; over monitor) Come in, Mother Bird, come in, Mother Bird. All the toys tense up. SARGENT (0.S.; over monitor) (continued) Mom has pulled a surprise present from the closet. Andy's opening it...

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: He's really excited about this one. It’s a huge package. Oh -- get out -- one of the kids is in the way, I can’t see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARGENT (0.S.; from monitor) it’s... it’s a -- The sound of children CHEERING emits from the monitor, cutting off the Sargent.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: It‘s a WHAT?! WHAT IS IT?!!! Rex grabs a leg of the nightstand and shakes it, making the monitor drop to the floor. The impact causes the batteries to roll out.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Oh, ya big lizard! Now we’ll never know what it is!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Way to go, Rex. Everyone rushes to the fallen monitor. Potato Head tries to correctly insert the batteries.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, no! Turn ‘em around, turn‘’em around!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Eh, he’s puttin’ ‘em in backwards. (shoving Potato Head aside) You’re puttin’ ‘em in backwards!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Plus is positive, minus is negative! Oh, let me! Woody jumps down off the bed and shoves both Hamm and Potato Head aside.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Let’s go to my room, guys! The kids rush past the houseplant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the monitor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody puts the last battery back in.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: There. SARGENT (0.S.; over monitor) Juvenile intrusion! Repeat! Resume your positions NOW!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Andy‘s coming, everybody! Back to your places. Hurry! The toys PANIC and scatter about the room.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Where’s my ear? Who’s seen my ear? Did you see my ear? .

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Outta my way! Here I come, here I come -- Frantic, Rex slams into a trashcan and falls over. Everyone scurries to their places as the KID’S FOOTSTEPS grow louder. Woody falls limp in his spot on the bed just as... Andy’s bedroom door flies open and a flood of children’s feet rush in.

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: Hey, look! His lasers light up.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Take that, Zurg! Woody is flung off Andy’s pillow and slides, unnoticed, down the gap between the bed and the back wall.

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: Quick! Make a space! This is where the spaceship lands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and you press his back and he does a karate-chop action!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on down, guys. It’s time for games! We‘ve got prizes!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah! The kids all run out as fast as they entered, SLAMMING THE DOOR behind them. °

dialogues.speaker: BEAT
dialogues.text: The toys slowly come to life and make their way toward the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: Can you see it?

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: What the heck is up there?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Woody? Who's up there with you? Woody crawls out from under the bed. The toys are shocked to discover him there.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Woody, what are you doing under the bed?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (composing himself) Uh-h-h-h... nothing! Uh, nothing. I’m sure Andy was just a little excited, that’s all. Too much cake and ice cream, I suppose. It’s just a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Well, that MISTAKE is sitting in your spot, Woody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GASP!) Have you been replaced?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hey! What did I tell you earlier? No one is getting replaced. The toys give each other a look of doubt.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Now let’s all be polite, and give whatever it is up there a nice, big “Andy’s Room” welcome. Woody climbs slowly up the side of the bed, peeking over the edge. His eyes widen at the sight of...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ LIGHTYEAR
dialogues.text: We see Buzz as Woody does - an expensive looking space age action figure, covered with buttons and stickers from head to toe. The imposing “G.I. Joe-sized” doll stands heroically in the center of the bed, his back to Woody. Woody GULPS. Buzz comes alive and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he scans the bedroom a “DARTH VADER” LIKE BREATHING is heard. Buzz eyes it all suspiciously and pushes a button on chest.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Buzz Lightyear to Star Command. Come in, Star Command. Nothing. He pushes the button again.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Star Command - come in. Do you read me? {to himself) Why don’t they answer?!! Just then, Buzz catches sight of his ripped packaging. The box is designed to look like a spaceship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) (GASP) My ship!! He runs up to the box and investigates the damage.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Blast! This‘1l take weeks to repair! Buzz flips open a plastic compartment on his arm -- his wrist communicator.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Buzz Lightyear Mission Log. Stardate 4072: My ship has run off course en route to sector 12. I've crash landed on a strange planet. The impact must have awoken me from hyper-sileep. Buzz springs up and down on the squishy surface of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: {into communicator) ° Terrain seems a bit unstable... He taps the sticker of controls on his wrist communicator.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (into communicator) No read-out yet if the air is breathable... and there seems to be no sign of intelligent life anywhere ~- ANGLE: BUZZ‘S POV THROUGH HIS HELMET Woody's face suddenly pops into view.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hello-o-o...

dialogues.speaker: HO-YAAAHH
dialogues.text: Buzz jumps back, taking a fighting stance. He presses a button on his arm that turns on a red “laser beam" light on his wrist. Buzz aims the red beam on Woody’s forehead and holds it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: woOoDY Aaaaaaah! Whoa, hey, whoa, did I frighten you? Didn’t mean to. Sorry. Howdy! My name is Woody and this is Andy’s room. That’s all I wanted to say, and also, there has been a bit of a mix-up. This is my spot, see, the bed here -- While Woody is speaking, Buzz notices the sheriff‘s badge on Woody's vest.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (de-activating his laser beam) Local law enforcement! It’s about time you got here. I’m Buzz Lightyear, Space Ranger, Universe Protection Unit. My ship has crash landed here by mistake. Buzz begins walking around the bed, surveying the situation. Woody tries to keep up. WOODY . Yes, it is a mistake, because, you see, the bed, here, is my spot.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I need to repair my turbo boosters. Do you people still use fossil fuels, or have you discovered erystalic fusion?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Well, let‘s see, we’ve got double A's ~--

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Watch yourself! ! Buzz shoves Woody down on the bed and re-activates his wrist laser.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (continued) Halt! Who goes there?! The other toys are peeking over the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Don’t shoot! It’s okay! Friends!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Woody) Do you know these life forms?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Yes. They’re Andy’s toys.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Alright, everyone. You're clear to come up. Buzz walks over to the toys.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I am Buzz Lightyear. I come in peace. Rex steps forward and eagerly shakes Buzz’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m so glad you're not a dinosaur!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Why, thank you... (pulls away) Now thank you all for your kind welcome.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Say! What's that button do?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I’1l show you. Buzz presses a button on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (SAMPLED VOICE)
dialogues.text: Buzz Lightyear to the rescue! The toys all GASP IN AWE.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Hey, Woody’s got something like that. His is a pullstring, only it

dialogues.speaker: POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Only it sounds like a car ran over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, but not like this one. This is a quality sound system. Probably all copper wiring, huh? So, uh, where are you from? Singapore? Hong Kong?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Well... no, actually I’m stationed up in the Gamma Quadrant of Sector 4. As a member of the elite Universe Protection Unit of the Space Ranger Corps, I protect the galaxy from the threat of invasion from the Evil Emperor Zurg, sworn enemy of the Galactic Alliance. As Buzz speaks, Woody glances down at the box in which Buzz arrived. ANGLE: BACK OF BUZZ’S BOX There is a cartoon drawing of Buzz giving the exact, word-for-word spiel that Buzz is now giving.

dialogues.speaker: POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Oh, really? I’m from Playskool.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: And I’m from Mattel. Well, I'm not really from Mattel, I’m actually from a smaller company that was purchased in a leveraged buy-out. Well, I don’t really understand the financials, but... Woody walks over to Bo Peep.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You’d think they’ve never seen a new toy before.

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: Well sure, look at him. He's got more gadgets on him then a swiss army knife. Slinky presses the button on Buzz’s arm, activating his laser light. Buzz quickly pulls his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, ah, ah, please be careful! You don‘t want to be in the way when my laser goes off.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Hey, a laser! How come you don’t have a laser, Woody?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: It’s not a laser! It’s a little lightbulb that blinks!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: What's with him?

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Laser-envy. woOoDY All right, that’s enough. Look, we're all very impressed with Andy's new toy --

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Toy?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: T-O-Y. Toy.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I think the word you're searching for is Space Ranger.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: The word I'm searching for I can’t say because there’s pre-school toys present.

dialogues.speaker: POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Gettin’ kind of tense, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, Mr. Lightyear? Now I’m curious. What does a Space Ranger actually do?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: He's not a Space Ranger! He doesn't fight evil or shoot lasers or fly --

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Excuse me.
Buzz calmly hits a button and wings pop out. Again the toys GASP IN AWE.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Oh, impressive wingspan. Very good!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, what?!...What?! These are plastic. He can’t fly!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: They are a terillium-carbonic alloy and I CAN fly.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, you can't.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Yes, I can.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You can't!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Can!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Can‘t! Can‘t! Can't!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I tell you, I could fly around this room with my eyes closed!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay then, Mr. Lightbeer! Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: All right, then, I will. (to toys) Stand back everyone! The crowd of toys make room for Buzz as he heads towards the edge of the bed and climbs up the bedpost. He poses like a high diver, shuts his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: To infinity and beyond!! and leaps off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz plummets straight down, hits a big rubber ball and bounces right back up. He then lands on a Hotwheels car, which races him down the track, through the loop, and off a ramp. Buzz soars upward into a plane mobile hanging from the ceiling. Buzz becomes wedged between the plane’s wheels. The impact turns on the PLANE'S MOTOR making it (and Buzz) spin around and around. All the other toys watch from the bed, mesmerized. Finally the centrifugal force causes Buzz to separate from the plane, sailing him across the room toward the bed. Buzz makes a perfect landing right in front of Woody and then opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Can. The crowd of toys rush Buzz, CHEERING AND CLAPPING WITH ADORATION.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Whoa! Oh, wow! You flew magnificently!

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: I found my moving buddy!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Why, thank you. Thank you all. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: That wasn’t flying! That was falling with style!

dialogues.speaker: POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Man, the dolls must really go for you! (aside) Can you teach me that? Woody stands alone at the other end of the bed, fuming. Slinky, caught up in the euphoria, approaches Woody .

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Heh, heh, heh! Golly bob howdy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up! In a couple of days, everything will be just the way it was. They'll see... they'll see. I'm still Andy’s favorite toy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONG: STRANGE THINGS plays over montage. INT. ANDY’S ROOM - LATER A) Andy plays with Woody: jumping up and down on the bed, running around the room. B) Andy sets Woody down on the floor. Next he “lands” Buzz Lightyear on the floor opposite Woody. Andy shoots Buzz’s laser at Woody and then smacks Woody across the room as if he’d been blown away by the laser. Cc) Andy runs into his closet wearing his cowboy hat and cowboy pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: MATCH CUT TO
dialogues.text: Andy runs out of the closet clad in Buzz Lightyear pajamas and a homemade spaceman’s helmet.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Buzz Lightyear to the rescue. D) Woody observes all the cowboy-themed items in the bedroom transform to space motif: the posters, the drawings on the wall, the pillow, the bedspread. E) Buzz watches Rex execute a WIMPY ROAR. The space ranger suggests a few tips for the dinosaur. Rex tries again, this time giving a “JURASSIC PARK” ROAR. The roar blasts Potato Head’s features right off his face. F) Woody passes Etch-A-Sketch, who’s sporting a portrait of Buzz. Woody looks across the room to see Buzz combing Troll Doll's hair, chatting away like a hair dresser. Woody angrily shakes Etch, removing Buzz’s image. G) Rocky, Snake, Troll Doll and Rex are lifting Tinkertoys as weights. Buzz works out on top of an upside down Robot, using his feet as a treadmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potato Head attempts to lift his Tinkertoy barbell but ends up tumbling backwards, leaving his arms connected to the barbell. H} Woody looks under the bed for Slinky, finding only the checkerboard. Woody peeks around the corner of the bed to see Slinky and Robot, under Buzz’s direction, setting Buzz's “ship” up on top of ABC blocks for repair. In frustration, Woody kicks the checkerboard, sending the pieces flying. One of the checkers ricochets off the dresser and boomerangs into Woody's mouth. I) On Andy's bed, Buzz pets Slinky whose back end is stretched over to the other side where Woody sits. Slinky's wagging tail whacks Woody in the face repeatedly. Woody shoves Slinky’s rear end off the bed, leaving his front end no choice but to eventually follow. J) At bedtime, Andy loads his toys into the toybox until just Woody and Buzz are left. He deliberates as to which toy to keep and which to toss into the toybox. INT. ANDY’S ROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT Andy is sound asleep, with Buzz tucked under the covers next to him. Woody peeks out at them from the toybox and then sadly sinks back into the box, closing the lid to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black screen splits horizontally to become... INT, ANDY’S BEDROOM - MORNING - WOODY’S POV OF THE

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM FROM THE TOY BOX
dialogues.text: All is clear -- no sign of Andy. Woody throws open the lid of the toy box.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Finally! He takes a couple DEEP BREATHS of fresh air, then discovers that his hat is missing. -32-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back into the toy box) Hey! Who’s got my hat? The rubber shark pops up wearing Woody's cowboy hat.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK
dialogues.text: Look, I'm Woody. Howdy, howdy, howdy!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Ah-hah! Ah-hah-hah! {grabs the hat) Give me that! Woody leaps out of the toy box.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Say there, Lizard and Stretchy Dog. Let me show you something. It looks as though I’ve been accepted into your culture. Woody looks up to see Buzz chatting with Rex and Slinky.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (continued) Your Chief, Andy, inscribed his name on me. Buzz juts his foot out so that Slinky and Rex can see the sole of his boot. The name “ANDY” is written on it in permanent marker.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: With permanent ink, too!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Well, I must get back to repairing my ship. Buzz walks away. Woody looks at HIS foot -- “Andy” is written on it also but in a much more childish scrawl, and is largely faded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don‘t let it get to you, Woody. Hearing Bo, Woody puts his foot back down and quickly straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Uh, let what? I don’t -- Uh, what do you mean? Who?

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: I know Andy’s excited about Buzz, but you know, he'll always have a special place for you.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: (walking past) Yeah. Like the attic. Heh, heh...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Alright! That's it! Woody angrily marches across the room.. Across the room, Buzz’s cardboard ship is still up on the ABC blocks. Buzz lies down on a skateboard and slides under the ship like a mechanic. Snake and Robot. stand by waiting for instructions. Buzz’s hand reaches out from under the ship.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Unidirectional bonding strip. Robot turns towards Snake who stands in readiness by a tape dispenser.

dialogues.speaker: ROBOT
dialogues.text: Mr. Lightyear wants more tape! Snake rips off a piece of tape with his mouth. Woody approaches the skateboard, grabs hold of Buzz’s foot and rolls him out from under the ship.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Listen, Lightsnack, you stay away from Andy. He‘’s mine, and no one is taking him away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? (to Robot) Where’s that bonding strip?! Buzz rolls himself back under. Woody rolls him out again.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: And another thing. Stop with this spaceman thing. It's getting on my nerves.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Are you saying you want to lodge a complaint with Star Command?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh okay, so you want to do it the hard way, huh? Buzz stands up, face to face with Woody.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Don’t even think about it, cowboy!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, tough guy?! Woody pushes Buzz in the chest, accidentally activating a button that makes the spaceman’s helmet open. Buzz grabs his neck, GASPING FOR AIR. He drops to his knees and begins to writhe on the ground, holding his breath. Woody is unsure how to react. Suddenly, Buzz SNIFFS the air.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: The air isn’t toxic. Buzz rises and points an accusing finger at Woody.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: How dare you open a spaceman’s helmet on an uncharted planet! My eyeballs could’ve been sucked from their sockets! Buzz closes his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You actually think you’re THE “Buzz Lightyear?” Oh, all this time I thought it was an act! (to the room) Hey, guys! Look! It’s the REAL Buzz Lightyear!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You're mocking me, aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, no... (pointing behind Buzz) Buzz, look! An alien!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Where? Buzz falls for the trick and turns around. Woody keels over with LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Woody stops short. All the toys look to the bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: SID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yessss! Ah, ha, ha, ha...

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Slinky hides under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: It’s Sid!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I thought he was at summer camp!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: They must have kicked him out early this year. The toys rush over to the window.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Not Sid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Incoming! From out the window, SID PHILLIPS, a hyperactive ten- year-old, and his dog, SCUD, can be roughly made out jumping around in their backyard. A tiny figure stands isolated in the center of the yard. Sid pummels the figure with rocks while Scud strains at his leash, barking wildly.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Who is it this time?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Iocan’t tell. Hey, where’s Lenny?

dialogues.speaker: LENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Right here, Woody. Woody turns to see, LENNY, a pair of wind-up binoculars, approaching him from the other end of the desk. Woody picks Lenny up and looks through him to survey the scene.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I can't bear to watch one of these again! ANGLE: BINOCULAR VIEW OF SID‘S BACKYARD A full size toy soldier is posed in a running stance in the center of the backyard. A huge M-80 is strapped to the doll’s back with masking tape.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, no... it's a Combat Carl.

dialogues.speaker: SID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (plays under the next 5 lines) Just stay where you are, Corporal! Don’t move, Carl. You’ll blow up. I know you're tired! I know your leg is cramping, but you can’t move. Do you hear me? Buzz breaks through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing that concerns you spacemen. Just us TOYS.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I'd better take a look anyway. Buzz grabs Lenny from Woody and looks through him.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Why is that soldier strapped to an explosive device?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (redirecting Buzz's view) That’s why. Sid.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Sure is a hairy fellah.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No! No, that’s Scud, you idiot! Again, Woody readjusts Buzz’s view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is sporting a skull t-shirt and LAUGHING HIDEOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: THAT is Sid!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You mean that happy child?

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: That ain’t no happy child.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: He tortures toys -- just for fun.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Well, then we've got to do something! Buzz steps up onto the window ledge. The toys GASP IN SHOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!! Get down from there!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I’m going to go teach that boy a lesson.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. You go ahead. Melt him with your scary laser. Woody presses Buzz‘s laser button. It emits a WIMPY ELECTRONIC BEEP. Buzz quickly pulls his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Be careful with that, it’s extremely dangerous. While Woody and Buzz banter, Lenny witnesses Sid lighting the fuse of the M80.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: He’s lighting it! He’s lighting it!

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Hit the dirt! The toys jump away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Dirt clods and toy shrapnel rain down along the side of Andy's house.

dialogues.speaker: SID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes! He’s gone! He’s history! Andy's toys peek over the window sill. ANGLE: SID‘’S YARD A large black scorch mark is all that remains where Combat Carl once stood. Sid jumps up and down victoriously while Scud resumes his BARKING.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I could have stopped him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz, I would love to see you try. (gesturing to Sid’s yard) ‘Course I'd love to see you as a crater. Sid CACKLES and dances around the crater.

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: The sooner we move the better.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ANDY‘S FRONT YARD - SUNSET A “FOR SALE“ real estate sign stands in the front yard. Another sign reading “SOLD” hangs from the bottom. INT. UPSTAIRS HALL/ANDY’S ROOM Mom opens the door to Andy's room and steps in. The room is full of packing boxes, most of them half full. Andy is playing with Woody and Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: To infinity and beyond!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh, all this packing makes me hungry. What would you say to dinner at, uh, oh, Pizza Planet?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Pizza Planet?! 0h, cool! Andy throws the two toys on his desk with Buzz landing right on top of Woody.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Go wash your hands and I‘1l get Molly ready. The minute the door is closed Woody comes alive and shoves Buzz off of him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Can I bring some toys?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You can bring ONE toy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one? Woody perks up with concern.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to himself) One toy? He glances over his shoulder at Buzz, who is walking away towards the opposite end of the desk. Woody picks up a Magic 8 Ball left beside him on the -desk. With his back to Buzz, Woody quietly shakes the 8 ball.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Will .Andy pick me? He tips the 8 ball over. The triangular oracle floats up to the surface. Its prediction reads: DON’T COUNT ON IT.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Don’t count on it?!! Doh-h-h-h! Woody throws down the 8 ball in disgust. It rolls across the desk and falls behind it with a LOUD THUD. Woody suddenly becomes interested in the back of the desk and peers down it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 8 ball is wedged way down near the bottom. The space is a black chasm, dark and deep, just big enough to fit...a toy. Woody looks across the desk at Buzz He is HUMMING TO HIMSELF as he forages through Andy’s pen/pencil tray looking for “tools” to repair his ship with. Right behind Buzz sits

dialogues.speaker: THE RC CAR
dialogues.text: It rests on the desktop, pointing in the direction where the 8 ball fell, with the remote laying by its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody smiles for a beat and then runs ina Panic over to Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Buzz!! Oh, Buzz, Buzz Lightyear!! Buzz Lightyear, thank goodness! We’ve got trouble!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Trouble?! (looking around) Where?!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (pointing to the back of the desk) Down there. Just down there. A helpless toy... it’s.... it's trapped, Buzz!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Then we‘ve no time to lose!! Buzz runs over and looks down the back of the desk.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I don’t see anything! Woody picks up the remote for the RC Car and switches it on. RC’s eyes (headlights) open sleepily.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, he’s there. Just, just keep looking. Woody hits the “FORWARD” button on the remote and steers the RC Car straight for Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What kind of a toy -- ? Buzz turns to see RC headed straight for him. He dives out of the way as the RC Car SMASHES into the base of...

dialogues.speaker: A BULLETIN BOARD
dialogues.text: The impact forces pushpins to fly out of the board. Buzz ducks as pins land all around him, sticking into the desk like arrows.

dialogues.speaker: POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: sits on the floor in the midst of a card game with Hamm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at the desk and GASPS as the bulletin board slams down onto...

dialogues.speaker: A GLOBE
dialogues.text: knocking it out of its stand. The globe starts rolling right at Buzz. Woody stands frozen in disbelief at the chaos he’s created. Buzz runs along the desk, the globe rolling right behind him, Indiana Jones style. Buzz gets stuck “log rolling” on a pile of pencils, but at the last second jumps out of the way onto the window ledge. The globe lumbers past Buzz and strikes a Luxo-style desklamp. The arm of the lamp swings all the way around, barely missing Woody... --and knocks Buzz out the window.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Buzz!!! Woody looks out the window. No sign of Buzz. All the other toys rush over to the sill.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: I don’t see him in the driveway! I think he bounced into Sid's yard. Woody backs away from the COMMOTION, unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: (GASP) Buzz!

dialogues.speaker: RC CAR
dialogues.text: (electric motor sounds) Whirrr!! Whirrrr-whirrrr!!! Rex looks over at RC. The remote control car is bouncing up and down excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Hey everyone! RC’s trying to say something! The toys turn from the window to RC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning down close to RC) What is it, boy?

dialogues.speaker: RC CAR
dialogues.text: (electric motor sounds) Whirrr!!! Whirrr! Whirrrrrr!!

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: He’s sayin’ that this was no accident.

dialogues.speaker: TOYS
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: I mean Humpty Dumpty was pushed. (pointing at Woody) . by Woody.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: The toys turn to Woody who suddenly realizes how this looks.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You -- you don’t think I meant to knock Buzz out the window, do you Potato Head?

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: That’s Mr. Potato Head to you, you back-stabbin’ murderer! woOoDY Now, it was an accident! Guys, ¢’mon now, you...you gotta believe me. .

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: We believe you, Woody. Right, Rex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing away) Oh, I don’t like confrontations. The Sargent pops out of the army bucket next to Woody.

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: Where is your honor, dirtbag?! You are an absolute disgrace! You don't deserve to -- Woody seals the lid back on the bucket. Potato Head starts closing in on Woody.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Couldn‘t handle Buzz cuttin’ in on your playtime, could ya Woody? Didn’t want to face the fact that Buzz just might be Andy's new favorite toy, so you got rid of him. Well, what if Andy starts playin’ with me more, Woody, huh? You gonna knock me outta the window, too? Potato Head has driven Woody back to the very edge of the desk -- trapped.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: I don’t think we should give him the chance. Suddenly, the lid pops off the bucket of army men.

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: There he is, men! Frag him! The army men yell CHARGE and pounce on Woody, while all the rest of the toys close in.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
dialogues.text: Let‘s string him up by his pull- string!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: I got dibs on his hat!

dialogues.speaker: BO PEEP
dialogues.text: Would you boys stop it?!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Tackle him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no! Wait! Wait I can explain everything --

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Andy, c’mon!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, Mom, be right down. I’ve got to get Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: SARGENT
dialogues.text: Retreat! The toys all drop Woody and rush back to their places. Andy enters the room and heads straight for the desk where Woody is lying. Andy overlooks Woody and begins searching around the room.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Mom! Do you know where Buzz is?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, I haven’t seen him. Woody painfully watches as Andy searches in vain for Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Psssst! Woody locks across the room. Potato Head and Etch-A-Sketch peek out of a packing box. Etch-A-Sketch scribbles a hangman's noose while Potato Head points an accusing finger in Woody's direction. Woody GULPS.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Andy! I’m heading out the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: But Mom, I can't find him!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, honey, just grab some other toy! Now c'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... He grabs Woody and walks out of the room. EXT. ANDY‘S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Andy exits the house dragging Woody as he heads toward the family van in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I couldn't find my Buzz. I know I left him right there.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm sure he’s around. You'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: A BUSH
dialogues.text: next to the van begins to rustle. Hands part the foliage, revealing Buzz. He eyes Woody going into the van and does a slow burn. The van ENGINE STARTS UP. Buzz races out of the bush, and with a mighty leap, grabs the rear fender of the van as it pulls out of the driveway. ANGLE: SIDE OF ANDY’S HOUSE A chain of monkeys falls into view, dangling a considerable distance above the ground. EXT. ANDY’S BEDROOM WINDOW - CONTINUOUS The rest of Andy’s toys have regrouped at the window, supervising the lowering of the “monkey chain”.

dialogues.speaker: SLINKY
dialogues.text: It’s too short! We need more monkeys !

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: (holding up an empty barrel) There aren’t any more! That's the whole barrel. Rex throws the barrel down and runs back to the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling out window) Buzz! The monkeys aren’t working! We’re formulating another plan! Stay calm! {beat) Oh, where could he be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Davis’ family van pulls up to one of the pumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy sits in the rear seat with Woody lying next to him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Can I help pump the gas?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Sure! I'’1l even let you drive. Both Mrs. Davis and Andy exit the van while baby Molly sleeps up front in her car seat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah?!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah -- when you're sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Yuk, yuk, yuk -- funny, Mom. With Mom and Andy out of range, Woody comes to life. He stares out the sun roof, still reeling from everything.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, great. How am I gonna convince those guys it was an accident? Suddenly, Buzz appears over the edge of the sun roof.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Buzz! Buzz jumps down on the back seat to face Woody. He is furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz! You’re alive! This is great! Oh, I’m saved! I’m saved! Andy‘1ll find you here, he’1l take us back to the room, and then you can tell everyone that this was all just a big mistake. Huh? No response from Buzz. Just an angry stare.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (weakly) Right? Buddy?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: I just want you to know that even though you tried to terminate me, revenge is not an idea we promote on my planet.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh, that’s good.

dialogues.speaker: BUZ2
dialogues.text: (getting in Woody's face) But we’re not on my planet, are we?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No. Buzz lunges for Woody. The two toys fly off the seat and out the open side door of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody and Buzz hit the ground and roll under the van, locked in mortal combat.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Ok! Come on! You want a piece of me?! Buzz lands a punch that sends Woody's head spinning around, Woody lunges with all his might. He smacks Buzz in the face, making it SQUEAK with every blow. Buzz closes his helmet on Woody’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owwwww! ! ! Woody pounds on Buzz’s chest with his free hand, activating BUZZ‘S SAMPLED VOICE buttons.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: The toys stop fighting. Before they can react...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Next stop...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pizza Planet! Yeah!!! The van drives off.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (GASP) Andy?! Woody starts to run in the direction of the van but it drives out of sight, leaving Buzz and Woody stranded. wooDY . Doesn‘t he realize that I’m not there? (beat) I’m LOST! Oh, I’m a lost toy! Meanwhile, Buzz checks the surroundings. He flips open his wrist communicator.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Buzz Lightyear Mission Log. The local Sheriff and I seem to be at a huge refueling station of some sort -- Woody whips around, his expression changing from panic to seething anger. He charges at Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: You!

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Just then the toys are bathed in the headlight beams of a behemoth tanker truck pulling into the station.  Buzz dives off to the side while Woody collapses right where he stands on the pavement. The truck ROARS over him.

dialogues.speaker: A GIGANTIC TIRE
dialogues.text: stops just millimeters from Woody’s nose. Petrified, Woody inches away from the tire, moving back under the truck until he bumps into Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (into wrist communicator) According to my nava-computer, the --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shut up! Just shut up, you idiot!!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Sheriff, this is no time to panic.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: This is the perfect time to -panic! I‘m lost, Andy is gone, they're going to move from their house in two days and it’s all your fault!!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: My fault?! If you hadn’t pushed me out of the window in the first place --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Well, if YOU hadn’t shown up in your stupid little cardboard spaceship and taken away everything that was important to me --

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to me about importance. Because of YOU the security of this entire universe is in jeopardy.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (incredulous) WHAT?!! What are you talking about?! Buzz walk to the edge of the truck tire and points up to the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, poised at the edge of the galaxy, Emperor Zurg has been secretly building a weapon with the destructive capacity to annihilate an entire planet. I alone have information that reveals this weapon’s only weakness. BUZZ (CONT‘D) (pointing at Woody) And you, my friend, are responsible for delaying my rendez-vous with Star Command. Woody explodes.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: YOU ARE A TOY!!! You aren’t the real Buzz Lightyear, you're an action figure!! You are a child’s plaything!!! Beat.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You are a sad strange little man and you have my pity. Farewell. Buzz walks off.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Well, good riddance, ya looney! Woody walks away in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to himself) Rendez-vous with Star Command.

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA DELIVERER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Gas Dude!

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You talkin’ to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, can you help me? Do you know where Cutting Blvd. is?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just a moment... Woody looks in the direction of the bell. His face lights up at the sight of... A PIZZA PLANET DELIVERY TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to himself) Pizza Planet... Andy! Woody takes a step forward and then stops.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, no! I can’t show my face in that room without Buzz. Woody runs back under the tanker truck. Buzz is at the far end of the truck, walking away from Woody.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Buzz! Buzz, come back!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: {continuing to walk away) Go away. Woody looks back at the delivery truck in desperation and then eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atop the truck is a rocket with the Pizza Planet logo.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, Buzz, you've gotta come back. I found a spaceship! Buzz stops walking away and looks back at Woody.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: It’s a spaceship, Buzz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The delivery truck’s engine has stalled and is off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C’mon, man, hurry up. Um, like the pizza’s are getting cold here. Woody and Buzz eye the parked delivery truck from within the safety of a nearby oilcan display.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Now you’re sure this spacefreighter will return to its port of origin once it jettisons its food supply?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. And when we get there, we‘ll be able to find a way to transport you... home.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Well, then let’s climb aboard. Buzz makes a beeline for the passenger side door of the pizza truck. Woody chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: No, no, no, wait, Buzz, Buzz, let’s get in the back. No one will see us there.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Negative. There are no restraining harnesses in the cargo area. We‘ll be much safer in the cockpit. In a flash, Buzz has scaled the front tire, grabbed the rear view mirror, and swung himself up and into the cab.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Yeah, but, Buzz! Buzz!

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA DELIVERER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ok, so that’s two lefts, and then a right, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA DELIVERER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks for the directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {loud whisper) Buzz!

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Woody runs around to the back of the truck, scrambles up the bumper and throws open the back hatch to climb inside. Woody lets out a YELL, as the back hatch slams back down on his rear, sending him flying into the bed of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody peeks through the dividing window into the cab. Buzz is hidden from THE PIZZA DRIVER’s view by a stack of pizzas in their insulated covers. Buzz prudently fastens his safety belt.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: It'll be safer in the cockpit than the cargo bay. What an idiot! The driver shifts into gear and hits the gas, propelling Woody to the back of the truck. The pizza deliverer drives like a maniac, taking sharp turns and hills at high speeds. Woody is helplessly thrown around the truck. With every blow, Woody YELPS in pain. The truck climbs a steep hill. Woody looks up just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE TOOL BOX
dialogues.text: barreling towards him.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: A STAR-FILLED BLACK NIGHT SKY
dialogues.text: We MOVE DOWN to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The delivery truck barrels into the parking lot and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the driver leaves the truck, Buzz peeks out from the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two imposing animatronic robots guard the doorway. As CUSTOMERS approach the front, the guards part their crossed “pizza spears”, allowing the patrons to enter.

dialogues.speaker: ROBOT GUARDS
dialogues.text: You are clear to enter. Welcome to Pizza Planet. VARIOUS ANNOUNCEMENTS blare out from speakers:

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE OVER SPEAKER
dialogues.text: Next shuttle lift-off scheduled for T-minus 30 minutes and counting...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE OVER SPEAKER
dialogues.text: The white zone is for eating pizza only. The white zone is for... Excited, Buzz pries open the window between the cab and truck bed.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Sheriff! Woody is gone. Just the toolbox and strewn trash.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (continued) Sheriff? The toolbox falls on its side revealing Woody. He peels off the back of the truck and falls into a pile of trash.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: There you are. Now the entrance is heavily guarded. We need a way to get inside. Woody rises from the trash with a “MEGA-GULP” cup on his head.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Great idea, Woody! I like your thinking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the f.g. sits a trashcan with fast food containers littered around it. MORE CUSTOMERS approach the “guarded” entrance.

dialogues.speaker: ROBOT GUARDS
dialogues.text: You are clear to enter. Welcome to Pizza Planet. The front doors automatically swing open as the people pass through. Suddenly two pieces of trash -- a burger container and “MEGA-GULP” cup stand up. BUZZ (in burger container)

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: The two disguised toys make a dash through the closing doors. BUZZ (in container} Quickly, Sheriff! The airlock is closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody and Buzz just make it inside but then freeze immediately as a GROUP OF KIDS run past, forcing the toys to pose as discarded trash. Once the coast is clear, Woody and Buzz resume walking. Buzz bumps into Woody.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (using straw as periscope) Ow! Watch where you're going!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (mouthing with burger box) Sorry. They sneak in between two long rows of video games and throw off their disguises. They then take a good look at...

dialogues.speaker: THE ARCADE
dialogues.text: The spaced-themed arena is filled with hordes of children playing video games. A sea of HI-TECH SOUNDS and lights overwhelm the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz is beaming with hope.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: What a space port. Good work, Woody. Woody is busy looking at all the children in the arcade, but none of the kids look familiar to him. Just then he HEARS...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom, can I play Black Hole? Please, Please, please?! Woody turns around and through the video games he spots...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: standing with Mom and Molly in her stroller.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to himself) Andy!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
dialogues.text: What's Black Hole?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s so cool... The family begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Now we need to find a ship that’s headed for Sector 12 -- Buzz is about to head off in the opposite direction when Woody grabs him and quickly pulls him down the video corridor,

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! No Buzz! This way! There‘s a special ship. I just saw it!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: You mean it has hyperdrive?

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hyper-active hyperdrive, and astro... uh, turf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toys manage to get ahead of Andy. Woody peeks around the corner of one of the video games and waits for Mom and Andy to approach.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (tracking Andy and family) C'mon, c’mon, that’s it...

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Where is it? I don’t see the -- Buzz stops short at the sight of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is modeled to look like a spaceship ready to launch.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (continued) Spaceship.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Alright Buzz, get ready... Buzz heads for the crane game, but Woody does not notice, his eyes locked on the approaching stroller.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Okay, Buzz, when I say “go,” we’re gonna jump in the basket -- Woody turns and realizes Buzz is gone. He looks across the way just in time to see Buzz leap into the crane game through the “PRIZE” slot.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: {loud whisper) Buzz!! Woody turns back in the direction of the stroller. It has already gone past.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Dooh! No! This cannot be happening to me!! Woody runs towards the crane game, but is forced to hold back for a moment as some SCREAMING children pass by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz climbs over the partition that divides the deposit slot from the prize toys and leaps into a pile of...

dialogues.speaker: SQUEEZE TOY ALIENS
dialogues.text: There are hundreds of them, all identical and way too cute.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: (excited) A stranger!

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: From the outside!

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Greetings! I am Buzz Lightyear! I come in peace!

dialogues.speaker: ALIENS
dialogues.text: Tell us! What is it like outside? The squeeze toys rush Buzz like JABBERING excited children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the kids gone, Woody crosses the aisle to the crane game and dives through the prize slot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody clambers up the side of the deposit slot.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is an intergalactic emergency! I need to commandeer your vessel to Sector 12! Woody peeks over the partition to witness Buzz surrounded by the cute alien toys.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: (continued; to the aliens) Who’‘s in charge here? All the aliens point upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cla~a-a-a-a-a-a-a-w! ! Woody and Buzz look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It dangles directly above the toys.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: The claw is our master.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: The claw chooses who will go and who will stay.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to himself) This is ludicrous.

dialogues.speaker: SID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (laughter) Woody GASPS at the recognition of Sid’s voice. He turns to see Sid heading straight for the crane game .

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Sid!!! Woody leaps off the partition and tackles Buzz, pushing the two of them deep into the pile of aliens.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Get down!! Sid approaches the crane game and fishes quarters out of his pants pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: {loud whisper) What’s gotten into you, Sheriff? I was --

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) YOU are the one that decided to climb into this --

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Sh-h-h-h-h-h. The claw. It moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It moves into position and hovers directly above the area where Woody and Buzz are hiding. The crane drops and grabs hold of the alien toy that is right on top of Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: (whispering excitedly) I have been chosen!! Positioned with his back to Sid, the alien is lifted up by the claw.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: (continued) Farewell, my friends! I go on to a better place.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Gotcha! With the alien gone, Buzz's upper torso becomes exposed, forcing the space ranger to freeze. Sid suddenly spots Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: A Buzz Lightyear! No way! Woody, still hidden, frantically looks around for some way to escape. Behind him, through the aliens, he eyes...

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL REPAIR DOOR
dialogues.text: Woody swims through the alien squeeze toys toward the door. He grabs hold of the locking latch and, aftera few attempts, is able to pry the door open. The shadow of the crane lines up over Buzz, lowers, and grabs his head. sID Yes! The claw begins to lift Buzz up.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (GASP) Buzz, NO! Woody grabs hold of Buzz’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody and the claw begin to have a tug-of-war with Buzz. Woody pulls down hard, forcing Buzz to sink into the pile of aliens, out of Sid’s view. sID {slamming his fist against the glass) Wha -- ? Hey!! Still tugging against the crane, Woody is almost out the door with Buzz. Just then, the aliens at the bottom of the pile pull Buzz and Woody back inside.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: He has been chosen.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: He must go.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: Stop it, you -- ! Stop it, you zealots!

dialogues.speaker: ALIENS
dialogues.text: He must go! Do not fight the claw! Do not anger the claw! He has been chosen. Woody and Buzz are pushed up to the surface and into the air, dangling lifelessly in front of Sid.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Alright! Double prizes! Woody and Buzz are dropped into the prize slot and snatched up by Sid.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: (looking at his two new toys) Let’s go home and...play. Ha-ha-ha. ANGLE: CLOSEUP OF SKULL ON SID’S T-SHIRT

dialogues.speaker: MATCH DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. SID’S HOUSE - LATER THAT NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of the darkness appears Sid on his skateboard. He is HUMMING to rock music from his walkman while carrying his backpack in his hand. Sid leaps off the skateboard and walks up the front path towards the front door. Through the open zipper, Buzz peeks out of the backpack to see Sid‘s house. He recognizes Andy’s house next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz, Woody and a squeeze toy alien are scrunched up in the backpack.

dialogues.speaker: BUZZ
dialogues.text: Sheriff! I can see your dwelling from here! You're almost home.

dialogues.speaker: ALIEN
dialogues.text: Nirvana is coming! The mystic portal awaits!

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (to Alien} Will you be quiet?!! (to both) You guys don’t get it, do you? Once we go into Sid’s house, we won’t be coming out. ANGLE: TOYS’ POV FROM OUT BACKPACK The front door opens to reveal Scud. The dog lunges straight for the backpack, BARKING. sID Whoa, Scud! Hey, boy. Sit! Good boy! The dog begrudgingly obeys.

dialogues.speaker: SID
dialogues.text: Hey, I got somethin’ for ya, boy. Sid‘s hand reaches into the backpack.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY
dialogues.text: (loud whisper)

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE
